messages.text: Hello everyone! I'm Vighnesh, a drummer of 8 years  and I was going through projects when I found automated music generation. I have read the resources and found it to be right my my alley. I also learnt the basics of Flux and just wrote a simple model in it. I would like to know more as to how I can start working towards contributing to this project. I would love to connect to anyone who can point me in the right direction! I'm looking forward!

messages.text:
Greetings everyone! I'm a senior year UG at IIT Kanpur, India aiming at this year's GSoC & JSoC. Came across Julia for performing large-scale simulations and loved it! I've sound background in Numerical Methods, Linear algebra & DEs and am interested in contributing to GenericLinearAlgebra.jl; TaylorModels.jl & Discretizations of PDEs.
Please tag the potential mentors. Thanks in advance :)

messages.text:
Hi guys. My name is Som Tambe, and I am also from IIT Kanpur coincidentially. I am an undergraduate here majoring in Aerospace Engineering. I like GPUs and am acquainted with writing kernels in CUDA. Right now I have explored CUDA.jl and it is really a superb abstraction over CUDA C++ given the absolutely lovely performance I get over it compared to CUDA C++ (weighing in the abstractions).
I would love to work this summer making GPU kernels in Julia for GSOC.
Hope everyone reading this has a great day! Cheers!

messages.text:
Hi everyone.
I'm Sambhaw, a UG student from IIT Kharagpur, looking forward to contributing in Mathematical libaries, Deep Learning and Natural Language Processing in Julia. 
I'm highly intrigued by theoretical Computer Science and AI given their high momentum in these times.
Currently, I am exploring the possibilities in JuliaText and Flux (supplemented with minor patches). 
Feel free to discuss any new ideas. I am decently equipped with knowledge in planning, DL and RL. 
I'm looking forward to GSOC and JSoC this year. 
I would love to contribute to and interact with this wonderful community. 
Have a good day! :smile:

messages.text:
Hello people.
I am Harsh , I am a student pursuing my  bachelors in computer engineering. I am interested in Machine Learning algorithms. I came across Julia a couple months back and want to be part of its community. I want to contribute towards this fast growing language.
Currently I am going through all the documentations and exploring the libraries of Julia. I would highly appreciate if someone could give some guidance points about what should I learn and how should I proceed to explore and make implement my own ideas here.

messages.text:
Hey everyone! I'm Atreya, currently pursuing my Bachelor's in Electronics and Communications Engineering. I've always been really interested in scientific computing, and I'd love to start my open source journey with Julia! My primary fields of interest are Machine Learning (more towards the deep learning bit but I like statistical modeling as well), and Signal Processing (Digital Speech and Audio Signals in particular)!
I've been learning Julia and I feel more comfortable with it now. I'd like to start contributing to existing issues.
I had a question: Do packages like JuliaDSP fall under the Julia umbrella (in terms of the org maintaining the package), or is it considered to be a completely separate entity?

I am very passionate about Deep Learning and I'm actively involved on its various applications. I have a strong passion for sequential models and would love to work on projects involving them!

messages.text: Hi all! I'm Aayush, currently studying for my Bachelor's in Computer Science and Engineering at IIT Ropar. I really love what the Julia ecosystem provides in terms of scientific computing. My area of interest is Agent based modeling and I'm actively contributing to Agents.jl.

messages.text:
Hi everyone! I'm José Joaquín Zubieta Rico. I'm a student of a Bachelor program in Computer Science at the University of Guanajuato (Universidad de Guanajuato) and CIMAT (Research Institute of Mathematics) in México. I've been using Julia for a couple of years as part of a research project and for work at my school.
Love the language, the environment and the community around it. I'm really interested in contributing to an open source project and I think the Julia ecosystem is a really nice fit giving my area of study and interest (scientific computing in general, but specific in machine learning, numerical methods, and a hobby reading about programming language theory, HPC and compilers).
I would really like if someone could give me mentoring and guidance on the ecosystem, the language and how to get more involved, solve issues and contribute with new projects and ideas. Really exited to be able to contribute! :conga_parrot: :smile:

messages.text:
Hi everyone, This is Shivanshu, a sophomore at IIT Kanpur. I've used julia in the past, actually explored it because i wanted to learn some cool new language XD. Now, I'd like to take my chance contributing to it. I'm mostly interested in flux,jl
So, I was wondering if it's okay if i go ahead and try to implement some of the functions as stated in <https://github.com/FluxML/Flux.jl/issues/1431|1431>? I'm just starting out in the Julia Community, so I'd really appreciate if anyone can guide me.
Thanks in advance.

messages.text:
Time for a proper introduction:slightly_smiling_face:...Hey all, I am Ashwani Rathee IT sophomore at UIET,Panjab University,Chandigarh.I am currently learning about image processing and ml with focus on the microbes classification.I have interests in image analysis,signal processing,chemo informatics,webrtc,sentiment analysis(afterall I am just too young for settle for one thing tbh).I actively participate in hackathons,so love high intensity environments...but also open sourcing those projects(I am a team guy,so lots of team projects) afterwards and continuing the work,cause that's how we roll.

I have contributed in past to sciml(with the website's base,transfer of data),juliamusic and currently working on JuliaImages for some time now.
My teams open source projects: <https://github.com/Node-Hacks>
Github: <https://github.com/ashwani-rathee>
LinkedIn: <https://www.linkedin.com/in/ashwani-rathee-0b7594192/>
